suncertify.server

Class BrokerServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.server.BrokerServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BrokerServerIF
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BrokerLocalServer, BrokerRMIServer

    public abstract class BrokerServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements BrokerServerIF
    The BrokerServer class is the abstract baseclass for the server types in the application. It also servers as the factory for the creation of the appropriate server type depending on the application run mode. It implements the BrokerServerIF interface.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    getServer(AppRunMode), BrokerServerIF, BrokerLocalServer, BrokerRMIServer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger atomicInteger
      A reference to an AtomicInteger object used by the server for generating unique identifiers for DBUpdateListener registering for database updates.
      protected DBMain dbAccessObject
      A reference to a DBMain object
      private java.util.logging.Logger logger
      This is a reference to a Logger object.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,DBUpdateListener> updateListeners
      A reference to a Map object used for the mapping of unique identifiers to DBUpdateListener objects.

      The default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BrokerServer

        protected BrokerServer()
        The default constructor. This creates the map for storing the listener ID/DBUpdateListener pairs.

    • Method Detail

      • getServer

        public static BrokerServer getServer(AppRunMode runMode)
                              throws BrokerServerException
        This method provides the API for the creation of the different server types supported in this application.
        Parameters:
        runMode - The application run mode.
        Returns:
        A reference to BrokerServer object type depending on the run mode parameter.
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - If an invalid run mode is specified or if an error was encountered while creating the appropriate server.
        See Also:
        AppRunMode, BrokerLocalServer, BrokerRMIServer

      • startServer

        public abstract void startServer()
                          throws BrokerServerException
        This is an abstract method that must be implemented in the subclasses of this class. The expectation is that the startup process will be unique to each server type.
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - is thrown when an error is encountered in the startup process.

      • stopServer

        public abstract void stopServer()
                         throws BrokerServerException
        This is an abstract method that must be implemented in the subclasses of this class. The expectation is that the shutdown process will be unique to each server type.
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - is thrown when an error is encountered in the shutdown process.

      • addRecord

        public int addRecord(ContractorRecord record)
              throws DuplicateKeyException,
                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method adds a new record to the application database and notifies all the database update listeners of the change to the database.
        Specified by:
        addRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        record - The reference to the ContractorRecord object to be added to the database.
        Returns:
        An integer value denoting a unique identifier for the newly added record.
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - is thrown if a record exists with a key that matches that of the new record.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        Data.create(String[])

      • getRecord

        public ContractorRecord getRecord(int recNo)
                           throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method retrieves a record from the application database.
        Specified by:
        getRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        recNo - An integer denoting the unique identifier for the record.
        Returns:
        A reference to the ContractorRecord object requested.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If a record uniquely identified by the record number does not exist or had been deleted.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        Data.read(int)

      • deleteRecord

        public void deleteRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         InvalidRecordStateException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method deletes a record from the application database. It compares the attributes of the record with the current value retrieved from the database, if there are changes the delete operation will not be done. The record is locked and unlocked before and after the delete operation respectively.
        Specified by:
        deleteRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        record - A reference to the ContractorRecord object to be deleted.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If a record uniquely identified by the record number does not exist or had been deleted.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the record had changes since it was last read by the client requesting the delete operation or if the record is currently locked by another thread.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        Data.delete(int), Data.lock(int), Data.unlock(int)

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(ContractorRecord oldRec,
                         ContractorRecord newRec)
                  throws InvalidRecordStateException,
                         RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method updates a record in the application database. It compares preupdate attributes of the record with the current value retrieved from the database, if there are changes the update operation will not be done. The record is locked and unlocked before and after the update operation respectively.
        Specified by:
        updateRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        oldRec - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the state of the record before the update.
        newRec - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the state of the record after the update.
        Throws:
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the record had changes since it was last read by the client requesting the update operation or if the record is currently locked by another thread.
        RecordNotFoundException - If a record uniquely identified by the record number does not exist or had been deleted.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        Data.update(int, String[]), Data.lock(int), Data.unlock(int)

      • bookRecord

        public void bookRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       InvalidRecordStateException,
                       RecordNotFoundException
        This method books a record. It compares the pre booking attributes of the record with the current value retrieved from the database, if there are changes the booking operation will not be done. The record is locked and unlocked before and after the booking operation respectively.
        Specified by:
        bookRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        record - An reference to the ContractorRecord object to be booked.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the record had changed since it was last read by the client requesting the book operation or if the record is currently locked by another thread.
        RecordNotFoundException - If a record uniquely identified by the record number does not exist or had been deleted.

      • releaseRecord

        public void releaseRecord(ContractorRecord record)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          InvalidRecordStateException,
                          RecordNotFoundException
        This method releases a booked record. It compares pre release attributes of the record with the current value retrieved from the database, if there are changes the release operation will not be done. The record is locked and unlocked before and after the release operation respectively.
        Specified by:
        releaseRecord in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        record - A reference to the ContractorRecord object to be released.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        InvalidRecordStateException - If the record had changed since it was last read by the client requesting the release operation or if the record is currently locked by another thread.
        RecordNotFoundException - If a record uniquely identified by the record number does not exist or had been deleted.
        See Also:
        Data.update(int, String[]), Data.lock(int), Data.unlock(int)

      • findRecords

        public ContractorRecord[] findRecords(ContractorRecord criteria)
                               throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method queries the application database for records that match a set of criteria.
        Specified by:
        findRecords in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        criteria - A reference to a ContractorRecord object denoting the record search criteria.
        Returns:
        An array of ContractorRecord objects denoting the records that match the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If no record matching the specified criteria was found.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        Data.find(String[])

      • registerUpdateListener

        public int registerUpdateListener(DBUpdateListener lstnr)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method adds a DBUpdateListener object to the list of database update listeners in this server.
        Specified by:
        registerUpdateListener in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        lstnr - A reference to a DBUpdateListener object.
        Returns:
        An integer value uniquely identifying the registered listener in this server. This number is needed for the call to the unregisterUpdateListener.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.
        See Also:
        unregisterUpdateListener(int), DBUpdateListener

      • unregisterUpdateListener

        public void unregisterUpdateListener(int listenerId)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method removes a DBUpdateListener from the list of database update listeners registered with this server.
        Specified by:
        unregisterUpdateListener in interface BrokerServerIF
        Parameters:
        listenerId - The unique identifier issued to the DBUpdateListener when it registered for database update notifications.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the server is a remote server and there was an issue communicating with it.

      • notifyListeners

        protected void notifyListeners()
        This method iterates through the list of registered DBUpdateListeners and notifies them of the changes to the database.
        See Also:
        DBUpdateListener
